division.heading: Hours of Poll and Matters Relating to Polling Stations

section.name: s27
section.heading: Appointment and notification of polling hours

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (2A) and (2B), the hours during which voters can cast their votes on polling day are to be appointed by the Chief Electoral Officer in accordance with this section. (L.N. 132 of 2009)
The Chief Electoral Officer may appoint different polling hours for different subsectors or for different polling stations.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: The Commissioner of Correctional Services may assign a time slot during the polling hours appointed for a dedicated polling station situated in a prison to a voter in custody to whom the polling station is allocated under section 30. (L.N. 132 of 2009)

subsection.name: 2B
subsection.content: Subject to section 55, a voter to whom a time slot is assigned under subsection (2A) may only cast his or her vote during the time slot. (L.N. 132 of 2009)
The Chief Electoral Officer must appoint the polling hours so as to give the voters a reasonable opportunity to vote.

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.content: The Commissioner of Correctional Services must assign the time slot so as to give the voters a reasonable opportunity to vote. (L.N. 132 of 2009)
The Chief Electoral Officer must, at least 10 days before polling day, publish in the Gazette, a notice specifying the polling hours for the subsectors and, if appropriate, for each polling station.

subsection.name: 4A
subsection.content: The Commissioner of Correctional Services must, as early as practicable before the commencement of the poll, notify all voters to whom time slots are assigned under subsection (2A) of the time slot assigned to each of them. (L.N. 132 of 2009)

subsection.def: In this section, voters (投票人) includes authorized representatives.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Chief Electoral Officer to designate polling stations and counting stations

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Electoral Officer must, in respect of a subsector election, designate, by notice published in the Gazette at least 10 days before polling day— (L.N. 132 of 2009; 15 of 2016 s. 61)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: one or more places as a polling station or polling stations for conducting a poll in respect of the election; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: one or more places as a counting station or counting stations for counting the votes. (L.N. 132 of 2009)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: Without affecting subsection (1), the Chief Electoral Officer must designate one or more places as a dedicated polling station or dedicated polling stations at which voters in custody or authorized representatives in custody are allocated to vote. (L.N. 132 of 2009)

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Electoral Officer may designate under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a structure, place or premises hired under subsection (3) or which is to be so hired;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any school in respect of which a grant is made out of the general revenue;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a building occupied by an organization, association or body in respect of which a grant is made out of the general revenue; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any other structure, premises, whether permanent or temporary, mobile or otherwise, or place, which the Chief Electoral Officer considers suitable for a purpose specified in subsection (1).

subsection.content: The Chief Electoral Officer may hire any structure, place or premises or a part of a structure, place or premises to designate as a polling station or a counting station.

The Chief Electoral Officer may designate a place described in subsection (2) in addition to or in substitution of a place designated under this section as a polling station or a counting station. The Chief Electoral Officer must publish notice of such designation. The notice may be published in a manner that Officer thinks fit.
The Chief Electoral Officer must ensure that there are sufficient polling stations and counting stations to enable polling and counting of votes to take place smoothly and efficiently.
The Chief Electoral Officer must make available, at that Officer’s office, for public inspection, a list of the polling stations and counting stations.

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Electoral Officer must, in the case of a polling station or a counting station which is not a Government building—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make good any damage caused; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: defray any expenses incurred by any person having control over the structure, place or premises,

subsection.continued: due to their having been used as a polling station or a counting station.

subsection.content: The Chief Electoral Officer may take such steps as that Officer considers appropriate, including taking out insurance, to insure against any risk of loss or damage that may arise due to or in connection with the use of any structure, place or premises as a polling station or a counting station.

The Chief Electoral Officer may, in relation to more than one subsector election, designate one counting station for the counting of the votes cast at all the polling stations used for polling for the subsector elections concerned.

section.name: s28A
section.heading: Chief Electoral Officer may require certain premises for use as polling stations or counting stations

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 28(1)(a) or (b), the Chief Electoral Officer may, by written notice, require an owner or occupier of any target premises to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: allow an authorized person to carry out a site visit at the premises for enabling the Officer to determine whether the premises are suitable for use as a polling station or counting station in a subsector election; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Officer considers the premises suitable—take the steps specified in subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: The steps specified for the purposes of subsection (1)(b) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to make available the premises for use as a polling station or counting station in the subsector election; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to allow an authorized person to carry out preparatory work and store materials at the premises for a purpose relating to such use.

subsection.content: If any target premises are used as a polling station or counting station as a result of a person’s compliance with a requirement made under subsection (1), the Chief Electoral Officer must pay to the person a user fee for the period during which the premises are so used.

subsection.leadIn: The amount of the user fee payable under subsection (3) is to be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: agreed between the person and the Chief Electoral Officer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if no agreement can be reached—determined by the court by reference to the loss suffered by the person for making available the premises.

subsection.content: A user fee payable under subsection (3) is to be paid out of the general revenue.
A person who fails to comply with a requirement made under subsection (1) is liable to pay a financial penalty of $50,000, which is recoverable as a civil debt due to the Government.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: authorized person (獲授權人) means a person authorized in writing by the Chief Electoral Officer for the purposes of this section;

def.name: Occupier
def.leadIn: occupier (佔用人), in relation to any target premises—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: means a tenant, subtenant or any other person in lawful occupation of the premises; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: does not include an owner of the premises;

def.name: Owner
def.leadIn: owner (業主), in relation to any target premises, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a person who appears from the records at the Land Registry to be the owner of—

subparagraph.content: the land on which the premises are situated; or
if the land is divided into shares—an undivided share in the land that relates to the premises; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a registered mortgagee in possession of such land or share;

subsection.def: target premises (目標處所) means a school or building described in section 28(2)(c) or (d) or any part of it.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Chief Electoral Officer to designate some polling stations as special polling stations

subsection.content: If the polling station or polling stations designated by the Chief Electoral Officer for a subsector would be difficult of access for persons with a disability, the Chief Electoral Officer must designate one or more polling stations as special polling station or stations to be used for voting by them. (15 of 2016 s. 62)
Only a polling station which, in the opinion of the Chief Electoral Officer, is suitable for use by persons referred to in subsection (1) may be designated as a special polling station.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: The Chief Electoral Officer may, for the purpose of subsection (1), designate as a special polling station any place which has been designated as a polling station under section 28. (L.N. 114 of 2006)

subsection.leadIn: In a notice published under section 28(1), the Chief Electoral Officer must indicate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the special polling stations (if any); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the subsector or subsectors for which a particular special polling station is designated. (15 of 2016 s. 62)

section.name: s30
section.heading: Chief Electoral Officer may arrange for voting for subsectors to take place at polling station and to allocate polling stations to voters and authorized representatives

subsection.content: The Chief Electoral Officer may make arrangements for voting for more than one subsector to take place at one polling station.

The Chief Electoral Officer must allocate to each voter and authorized representative a polling station or polling stations to cast the vote or votes he or she is entitled to cast at a subsector election.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: If a voter or authorized representative will be serving a sentence of imprisonment on the polling day, the Chief Electoral Officer may allocate to the voter or authorized representative a dedicated polling station to cast the vote or votes he or she is entitled to cast at a subsector election. (L.N. 132 of 2009)

If a person is entitled to cast more than one vote (one as a voter and the other as an authorized representative), the Chief Electoral Officer may allocate to that person the same polling station to cast both the votes.

The Chief Electoral Officer may, if that Officer considers it appropriate to do so in the circumstances, allocate to a voter or authorized representative an alternative polling station, in addition to or in substitution of the polling station or any of the polling stations, as the case may be, allocated under subsection (2), to cast the vote or votes he or she is entitled to cast at a subsector election.

subsection.leadIn: To enable the Chief Electoral Officer to perform his or her functions under this section in relation to electors, the Commissioner of Correctional Services must, upon a request by the Chief Electoral Officer, provide the following information concerning every person who is serving a sentence of imprisonment or detained by the Correctional Services Department on remand—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the number of the person’s identity document;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the prisoner registration number allocated by the Commissioner of Correctional Services to the person for identification purposes;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the name and address of the premises in which the person is detained. (L.N. 75 of 2011)

subsection.leadIn: To enable the Chief Electoral Officer to perform his or her functions under this section in relation to electors, the head of any law enforcement agency must, upon a request by the Chief Electoral Officer, provide the following information concerning every person who is detained by the law enforcement agency under any lawful authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the number of the person’s identity document;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the name and address of the premises in which the person is detained. (L.N. 75 of 2011)

section.name: s31
section.heading: Chief Electoral Officer to send poll cards to voters and authorized representatives

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (3) and (4), for every contested subsector election, the Chief Electoral Officer must, at least 5 days before polling day, send a poll card to each voter and authorized representative.

subsection.leadIn: A poll card need not be sent to a voter or authorized representative if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Chief Electoral Officer is satisfied, having regard to information received from the Registrar of Births and Deaths, that the voter or authorized representative is dead; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the Chief Electoral Officer is satisfied that the voter’s or authorized representative’s address as recorded in the subsector final register—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: does not exist;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: refers to a building that has been demolished; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: refers to a building that is not built at the time poll cards are to be sent.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: A poll card sent to a voter or authorized representative who will be serving a sentence of imprisonment in a prison on the polling day must be addressed to the voter or authorized representative and sent, as far as practicable, to the prison. (L.N. 132 of 2009)
A poll card need not be sent under subsection (1) to a corporate voter.

If the Chief Electoral Officer receives notice of the substitution or replacement of an authorized representative within the 5 days preceding polling day, that Officer need not send a poll card to the substitute or replacement authorized representative. The Chief Electoral Officer must inform that substitute or replacement authorized representative of the polling station allocated to him or her in a manner that Officer thinks fit.
The Chief Electoral Officer must state in the poll card the polling station or polling stations at which the voter or authorized representative must cast his or her vote or votes.

subsection.leadIn: As soon as practicable after having allocated to a voter or authorized representative an alternative polling station under section 30(4), the Chief Electoral Officer must, in a manner that Officer considers appropriate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: notify—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the voter or authorized representative;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the Returning Officer; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the Presiding Officer of the polling station previously allocated to the voter or authorized representative,

paragraph.continued: of the alternative polling station; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: notify—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Returning Officer;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the Presiding Officer of the polling station previously allocated to the voter or authorized representative; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the Presiding Officer of the alternative polling station,

paragraph.continued: of the name, identity document number and residential address (as they appear in the subsector final register) of the voter or authorized representative and the subsector for which the voter or authorized representative is entitled to vote.

subsection.def: In this section, corporate voter (團體投票人) has the meaning assigned to it by section 11(1) of the Schedule to the Chief Executive Election Ordinance (Cap. 569).

section.name: s32
section.heading: Person to vote at correct polling station

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), a person may only vote at the polling station or polling stations allocated to him or her under section 30.
A person who is allocated a special polling station under section 33 may only vote at that special polling station.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Chief Electoral Officer may allocate special polling stations

subsection.content: A voter or authorized representative who claims to be a person with a disability and that access to the polling station which is allocated to him or her under section 30 is difficult for him or her due to the disability, may apply to the Chief Electoral Officer to vote at the special polling station designated for the subsector for which he or she is entitled to vote.

subsection.leadIn: An application under subsection (1) must reach the Chief Electoral Officer at least 3 days before polling day. The application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: may be—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: made in writing; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: delivered by hand, by post, by electronic mail or by facsimile transmission; or (15 of 2016 s. 39)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may be made orally by telephone.

subsection.content: On receiving an application under subsection (1), the Chief Electoral Officer must, if satisfied that the application is well founded, allocate to the voter or authorized representative an appropriate special polling station to cast the vote he or she is entitled to cast at the subsector election to which the application relates.
The Chief Electoral Officer must inform the applicant in a manner that Officer considers appropriate, the result of the application, as soon as practicable.

subsection.leadIn: When the Chief Electoral Officer allocates a special polling station to a voter or authorized representative under this section, that Officer must, as soon as practicable, notify, in a manner that Officer considers appropriate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Returning Officer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Presiding Officer of the special polling station; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Presiding Officer of the polling station previously allocated to the voter or authorized representative,

subsection.continued: of the name, identity document number and residential address (as they appear in the subsector final register) of the voter or authorized representative.

subsection.content: The Chief Electoral Officer must notify the persons referred to in subsection (5) of the subsector for which the voter or authorized representative is entitled to vote.

The Chief Electoral Officer may, if that Officer considers it appropriate to do so in the circumstances, allocate to a voter or authorized representative an alternative special polling station, in addition to or in substitution of the special polling station allocated under subsection (3), to cast the vote he or she is entitled to cast at the subsector election.

subsection.leadIn: As soon as practicable after having allocated to a voter or authorized representative an alternative special polling station under subsection (7), the Chief Electoral Officer must, in a manner that Officer considers appropriate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: notify—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the voter or authorized representative; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the persons referred to in subsection (5),

paragraph.continued: of the alternative special polling station; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: notify—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the persons referred to in subsection (5); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the Presiding Officer of the alternative special polling station,

paragraph.continued: of the name, identity document number and residential address (as they appear in the subsector final register) of the voter or authorized representative and the subsector for which the voter or authorized representative is entitled to vote.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Chief Electoral Officer to appoint or remove Presiding Officer, etc. for each polling station

subsection.content: The Chief Electoral Officer must appoint a person to preside at each polling station.
The Chief Electoral Officer may appoint, as polling officers, persons that Officer considers suitable to assist the Presiding Officer in the conduct of a poll.
The Chief Electoral Officer may, at any time, with reasonable cause revoke the appointment of any Presiding Officer or polling officer. (L.N. 114 of 2006; L.N. 176 of 2006)

section.name: s35
section.heading: Chief Electoral Officer to supply candidates with copy of subsector final register

subsection.content: The Chief Electoral Officer must supply to each candidate a copy of the part of the subsector final register which relates to the subsector for which that candidate is nominated.

A copy under this section must be supplied to a candidate as soon as practicable after the relevant subsector nomination form is submitted to the Returning Officer. The copy may contain such additional particulars or information as the Chief Electoral Officer thinks fit to include.
The form in which the copy is supplied may be a printed form, a form which is capable of being read by a computer or any other form determined by the Chief Electoral Officer.
A copy for the purposes of this section may be supplied to the election agent of the candidate instead of to the candidate.

section.name: s36
section.heading: Chief Electoral Officer to supply Returning Officer with copy of subsector final register

subsection.content: The Chief Electoral Officer must supply to the Returning Officer a copy of the part of the subsector final register which relates to the subsector for which that Returning Officer is appointed.
A copy under this section must be supplied after the relevant notice of nominations is published under section 18.

The copy may contain the identity document numbers of the voters and authorized representatives and such other additional particulars or information as the Chief Electoral Officer thinks fit to include.
The form in which the copy is supplied may be a printed form, a form which is capable of being read by a computer or any other form determined by the Chief Electoral Officer.

section.name: s37
section.heading: Chief Electoral Officer to carry out other duties relating to polling stations

subsection.content: The Chief Electoral Officer must provide at each polling station sufficient compartments as that Officer considers necessary to enable voters and authorized representatives to mark ballot papers, screened from observation.

The Chief Electoral Officer must supply to each Presiding Officer, the number of ballot papers the Chief Electoral Officer considers necessary for the subsector or subsectors for which the polling station is to be used for polling. The Chief Electoral Officer must ensure that the name of any deceased or disqualified candidate regarding whom notice under section 20(1) or 21(1) is given or declarations under section 20(3) or 21(3) are made, and other information relating to that candidate, if printed on the ballot papers, are crossed out, or endorsed with a marking as directed by the Commission. (1 of 2019 s. 39; 8 of 2025 s. 27)
The Chief Electoral Officer must also supply to the Presiding Officer a copy of the part of the subsector final register relating to that subsector or subsectors.

The copy may contain the identity document numbers of the voters and authorized representatives and such other additional particulars or information as the Chief Electoral Officer thinks fit to include.
The form in which the copy is supplied may be a printed form, a form which is capable of being read by a computer or any other form determined by the Chief Electoral Officer.

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Electoral Officer must provide at each polling station—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: materials; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the polling station is to be used for polling for a subsector by-election in relation to which the Commission has made a direction under section 56(2), chops bearing the mark “✓”, with or without any design,

subsection.continued: that are necessary to enable voters and authorized representatives to mark the ballot papers.

subsection.content: The Chief Electoral Officer must do other acts and things as that Officer considers necessary for holding the poll effectively.

section.name: s37A
section.heading: Presiding Officer to display notice relating to deceased or disqualified candidates

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of, and other information relating to, a candidate (applicable candidate) on a ballot paper are crossed out, or endorsed with a marking as directed by the Commission, under section 37(2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the ballot paper is used for polling at a polling station.

subsection.leadIn: The Presiding Officer of the polling station must ensure that a notice specified in subsection (3) is displayed in a prominent place—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the polling station is not a dedicated polling station—outside the polling station; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the polling station is a dedicated polling station—inside the polling station.

subsection.leadIn: The notice must state that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the applicable candidate is—

subparagraph.content: a deceased candidate regarding whom a declaration referred to in section 20(3) has been made; or
a disqualified candidate regarding whom a declaration referred to in section 21(3) has been made; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name of, and other information relating to, the applicable candidate on the ballot paper are crossed out, or endorsed with a marking as directed by the Commission, under section 37(2).

section.name: s38
section.heading: Chief Electoral Officer to supply list of polling officers to assist Presiding Officer

subsection.content: The Chief Electoral Officer must supply to the Presiding Officer a list of the polling officers appointed for the polling station for which that Presiding Officer is appointed.

The Chief Electoral Officer must supply to the Returning Officer for a subsector a list of the polling officers appointed for the polling stations at which polling for that subsector is to take place.

subsection.leadIn: The Presiding Officer must display the list referred to in subsection (1) in a prominent place— (L.N. 75 of 2011)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: (if the polling station for which the Officer is appointed is not a dedicated polling station) outside the polling station; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (if the polling station for which the Officer is appointed is a dedicated polling station) inside the polling station. (L.N. 75 of 2011)

section.name: s39
section.heading: Presiding Officer to exhibit at polling station notice providing information for guidance of voters

subsection.leadIn: The Presiding Officer of a polling station must ensure that a notice providing information for the guidance of voters and authorized representatives in voting procedure is— (L.N. 132 of 2009)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: exhibited—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: if the polling station is not a dedicated polling station, outside the polling station; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the polling station is a dedicated polling station, inside the polling station; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: exhibited inside every voting compartment of the polling station. (L.N. 132 of 2009)

subsection.content: A notice under subsection (1) must be in the specified form.

section.name: s40
section.heading: Returning Officer to determine no canvassing zones and no staying zones

subsection.content: The Returning Officer for a subsector must determine an area outside each polling station used for polling for that subsector as a no canvassing zone and an area within that area as a no staying zone. A no canvassing zone and a no staying zone are to be determined with reference to a map or plan.

If a polling station is to be used for polling for more than one subsector, the determination of the no canvassing zone and the no staying zone is to be made by the Returning Officer specified for the purpose by the Chief Electoral Officer.
If a polling station is to be used for polling for only one subsector, the Returning Officer for the subsector must give notice to the candidates.

If a polling station is to be used for polling for more than one subsector, the Returning Officer who makes the determination must give notice to the candidates for the subsector for which that Officer is appointed and the Returning Officers for the other subsectors for which the polling station is to be used.
Notice under subsection (3) or (4) must be given at least 7 days before polling day. (L.N. 114 of 2006)

A Returning Officer who is given notice under subsection (4) must give notice to the candidates for the subsector for which that Officer is appointed as soon as practicable after that Officer receives the notice.

A Returning Officer who makes a determination of a no canvassing zone or a no staying zone may vary either or both of those areas in accordance with this section. Subject to subsection (11), notice of a variation must be given as soon as practicable after the variation in the same manner as notice of a no canvassing zone or a no staying zone is given under subsection (3) or (4).

On polling day, the Returning Officer who has determined the no canvassing zone or the no staying zone (or subsequently varied it, if applicable) must display at or near the polling station a notice of the no canvassing zone and the no staying zone. That Officer must also indicate the boundaries of those zones in a manner that Officer thinks fit.

If after display under subsection (8), either or both of those areas are varied, the Returning Officer must display at or near the polling station a notice of the no canvassing zone or the no staying zone or both those zones, if appropriate, as varied.

subsection.name: 9A
subsection.content: A Returning Officer may perform any act which the Officer is required or authorized to perform under subsections (7), (8) and (9) through a Presiding Officer. (L.N. 75 of 2011)
A determination of a no canvassing zone or a no staying zone or the variation of such an area becomes effective only on the display of a notice under subsection (8) or (9), as may be applicable.

A notice of a variation under subsection (7) need not be given to the candidates if it is not reasonably practicable to do so before the close of the poll. Notice may be given to the election agent or polling agent of a candidate if present at the polling station.
A notice required to be given to a candidate under this section may be given to the election agent or polling agent of the candidate instead of to the candidate.

subsection.def: For the purposes of this section, notice (通知、公告) means a notice of the determination of the no canvassing zone and the no staying zone with a map or plan or separate maps or plans showing those zones in relation to the relevant polling station.

subsection.leadIn: On polling day, a person must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (15), engage in canvassing for votes in a no canvassing zone; (L.N. 114 of 2006)

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: conduct any activity for canvassing for votes so that the sound of the activity can be heard in the no canvassing zone; (L.N. 114 of 2006)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (14A), use a sound amplifying system or device for any purpose in the no canvassing zone; (L.N. 75 of 2011)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: use a sound amplifying system or device, for canvassing for votes, so that the sound emitted by it can be heard in the no canvassing zone;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: subject to subsection (16), without reasonable excuse, display or wear in the no canvassing zone any badge, emblem, clothing or head-dress which— (L.N. 114 of 2006)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: may promote or prejudice the election of a candidate or candidates at the subsector election; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: makes direct reference to a political body in Hong Kong or to a body any member of which is standing as a candidate at the subsector election; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: stay or loiter in the no staying zone without the express permission of the Presiding Officer.

subsection.name: 14A
subsection.content: An officer of the Correctional Services Department may, on polling day, use a sound amplifying system or device for the performance of his or her duties in the no canvassing zone of a dedicated polling station situated in a prison. (L.N. 75 of 2011)

subsection.leadIn: On polling day, a person may, without obstructing any person, canvass for votes from door to door on the storeys above or below street level in a building within the no canvassing zone which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person is allowed to enter for the purpose of canvassing for votes; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has no polling station inside it. (L.N. 114 of 2006)

subsection.content: A person may, for the purpose of canvassing for votes pursuant to subsection (15), display or wear any badge, emblem, clothing or head-dress referred to in subsection (14)(d). (L.N. 114 of 2006)

section.name: s41
section.heading: Presiding Officer to keep order in no canvassing zone and no staying zone

subsection.leadIn: The Presiding Officer must use that Officer’s best endeavours to ensure that a person does not, on polling day—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: engage in canvassing for votes in the no canvassing zone (except as provided in section 40(15)); (L.N. 114 of 2006)

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: conduct any activity for canvassing for votes so that the sound of the activity can be heard in the no canvassing zone; (L.N. 114 of 2006)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (1A), use a sound amplifying system or device for any purpose in the no canvassing zone; (L.N. 75 of 2011)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: use a sound amplifying system or device, for canvassing for votes, so that the sound emitted by it can be heard in the no canvassing zone;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: (except as provided in section 40(16)) without reasonable excuse, display or wear in the no canvassing zone any badge, emblem, clothing or head-dress which— (L.N. 114 of 2006)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: may promote or prejudice the election of a candidate or candidates at the subsector election; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: makes direct reference to a political body in Hong Kong or to a body any member of which is standing as a candidate at the subsector election; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: stay or loiter in the no staying zone (except where the person has been expressly permitted to do so by the Presiding Officer).

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: An officer of the Correctional Services Department may, on polling day, use a sound amplifying system or device for the performance of his or her duties in the no canvassing zone of a dedicated polling station situated in a prison. (L.N. 75 of 2011)

subsection.leadIn: If, on polling day, in a no canvassing zone or a no staying zone, a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: misconducts himself or herself, the Returning Officer or the Presiding Officer may;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: fails to obey a lawful order of the Returning Officer, that Officer may; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: fails to obey a lawful order of the Presiding Officer, that Officer may,

subsection.continued: order the person to leave the no canvassing zone or the no staying zone, as the case may be, immediately.

subsection.leadIn: If a person fails to leave when ordered to do so under subsection (2), the person may be removed by— (L.N. 132 of 2009)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a police officer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person authorized in writing by the Returning Officer or the Presiding Officer, as may be appropriate; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the no canvassing zone or the no staying zone, as may be appropriate, is determined in relation to a dedicated polling station, an officer of the Correctional Services Department or any law enforcement agency. (L.N. 132 of 2009)

subsection.content: A person who is removed under subsection (3) may not enter the relevant zone again on that day, unless the Returning Officer or the Presiding Officer, as may be appropriate, permits him or her to do so. (L.N. 114 of 2006)
The powers conferred by this section are not to be exercised so as to prevent a person from voting at the polling station allocated to that person.

For the purpose of subsection (2) but without limiting it, a person misconducts himself or herself if the person causes an obstruction to any person who is in the no canvassing zone or the no staying zone and on his or her way to vote.

section.name: s42
section.heading: Candidates may appoint polling agents

subsection.content: A candidate may appoint persons to attend at polling stations on his or her behalf for any purpose connected with the conduct of a poll, in accordance with this section.
Polling agents may be appointed by a candidate to attend only at the polling stations used for polling for the subsector for which the candidate is standing for election.
A candidate may appoint a maximum of 2 polling agents for one polling station.
Only a holder of an identity card who has attained the age of 18 years may be appointed as a polling agent.
A candidate who appoints a polling agent must give notice of the appointment to the Chief Electoral Officer at least 7 days before polling day. (15 of 2016 s. 40)

subsection.name: 5AA
subsection.content: A notice of appointment given under subsection (5) must be delivered by hand, by post, by electronic mail or by facsimile transmission. (15 of 2016 s. 40)

subsection.name: 5A
subsection.leadIn: Despite subsections (1), (3) and (5)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraphs (b) and (c), only one polling agent may be appointed by a candidate for a dedicated polling station situated in a prison;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: no polling agent may be appointed by a candidate for a dedicated polling station situated in a prison if the Commissioner of Correctional Services has consented under section 23(15)(d) to the presence of the election agent of that candidate in that polling station;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: no polling agent may be appointed for a dedicated polling station situated in a maximum security prison; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: the appointment of a polling agent for a dedicated polling station situated in a prison is not effective unless— (15 of 2016 s. 40)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a notice of appointment is given in accordance with subsection (5); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the Commissioner of Correctional Services consents to the appointment. (L.N. 132 of 2009; 15 of 2016 s. 40)

subsection.name: 5B
subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (5A)(d), even though a notice of appointment is given during the week before polling day, the Commissioner of Correctional Services may still give consent under that subsection if the Commissioner is satisfied that— (15 of 2016 s. 40)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a voter in custody or an authorized representative in custody who is entitled to vote for the relevant subsector at a dedicated polling station situated in a prison is admitted or transferred to the prison during that week; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the notice of appointment is given without undue delay after the admission or transfer. (L.N. 132 of 2009; 15 of 2016 s. 40)

subsection.name: 5C
subsection.content: If the Commissioner of Correctional Services refuses to give consent under subsection (5A)(d), the Commissioner must notify the candidate or the election agent of the candidate as soon as practicable. (L.N. 132 of 2009)

subsection.leadIn: A notice appointing a polling agent for a polling station other than a dedicated polling station situated in a prison must, if it is not given under subsection (5), be delivered on the polling day to the Presiding Officer of the polling station— (L.N. 132 of 2009)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by the candidate in person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by the election agent of the candidate, in person.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (5A)(d), the appointment of a polling agent is not effective until notice of the appointment is received by the Chief Electoral Officer or the Presiding Officer, as may be appropriate. (15 of 2016 s. 40)
A notice of appointment must be in writing and in the specified form. It must state the name, identity card number and address of the polling agent. It must be signed by the candidate.

If the appointment of a polling agent is revoked, the candidate must give notice of the revocation to the Chief Electoral Officer or the Presiding Officer of the polling station in accordance with subsection (11) or (11A). (15 of 2016 s. 40)
A notice of revocation must be in writing and in the specified form. It must be signed by the candidate.

If notice of revocation is given before polling day, it must be delivered to the Chief Electoral Officer by hand, by post, by electronic mail or by facsimile transmission. (L.N. 75 of 2011; 15 of 2016 s. 40)

subsection.name: 11A
subsection.leadIn: If the notice of revocation is given on the polling day—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: (if the polling station for which the polling agent is appointed is not a dedicated polling station situated in a prison) it must be delivered to the Presiding Officer of the polling station by the candidate, or the election agent of the candidate, in person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (if the polling station for which the polling agent is appointed is a dedicated polling station situated in a prison) it must be delivered to the Chief Electoral Officer by hand, by electronic mail or by facsimile transmission. (L.N. 75 of 2011; 15 of 2016 s. 40)

subsection.content: The revocation of the appointment of a polling agent is not effective until notice of the revocation is received by the Chief Electoral Officer or the Presiding Officer, as may be appropriate.

section.name: s43
section.heading: Chief Electoral Officer to delineate polling stations on map and display map

subsection.content: The Chief Electoral Officer must delineate each polling station on one or more maps or plans. (L.N. 132 of 2009)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: The Chief Electoral Officer must display a map or plan referred to in subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b), outside the polling station concerned; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the map or plan is prepared for a dedicated polling station, inside the polling station. (L.N. 132 of 2009)

subsection.content: The Presiding Officer must demarcate clearly by marks, barriers or other means as that Officer thinks fit, the polling station in accordance with the map or plan referred to in subsection (1).
The Chief Electoral Officer and the Presiding Officer must carry out their functions under this section before the poll commences.

section.name: s44
section.heading: Who may enter or be present at polling station

subsection.content: Except where it is provided otherwise in this Regulation, a person must not enter a polling station other than to vote.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (4) and (5), in order to ensure that polling takes place smoothly and efficiently, the Presiding Officer may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: regulate the number of voters, authorized representatives, candidates, election agents and polling agents to be admitted to the polling station at any one time; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: exclude any person from the polling station.

subsection.content: Without limiting subsection (2), the Presiding Officer may exclude from the polling station any person who is present in contravention of this section.

subsection.leadIn: The Presiding Officer may not exclude from the polling station—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: polling officers;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Chief Returning Officer (Subsectors);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Returning Officers or Assistant Returning Officers for the subsectors for which the polling station is used;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: members of the Commission;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: public officers on duty at the polling station;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the Chief Electoral Officer;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: public officers authorized in writing by the Chief Electoral Officer; (L.N. 114 of 2006)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: persons authorized in writing by a member of the Commission; (L.N. 114 of 2006)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: police officers and members of the Civil Aid Service on duty at the polling station; (L.N. 114 of 2006; 14 of 2021 s. 207)

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: a person authorized in writing by the Returning Officer to act as a liaison officer; or (L.N. 114 of 2006; 14 of 2021 s. 207)

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: an individual who provides the assistance mentioned in section 114(2)(c) pursuant to an authorization under that section. (14 of 2021 s. 207)

subsection.content: A person authorized by the Commission to be present in a polling station may be present in accordance with the terms of the authorization.
Subject to subsections (7), (8), (9), (10), (11) and (12), on behalf of each candidate, one polling agent of that candidate may be present in the polling station at any one time.

subsection.name: 6A
subsection.content: Subsection (6) does not apply to a dedicated polling station situated in a maximum security prison. (L.N. 132 of 2009)
If a candidate is present in the polling station, the election agent or polling agent of that candidate may not be present in that polling station at the same time.
If the election agent of a candidate is present in the polling station, a polling agent of that candidate may not be present in that polling station at the same time.
A candidate, an election agent or a polling agent may be present in the polling station subject to the availability of seats in the area designated to accommodate them.

A person referred to in subsection (9) who wishes to be admitted to the polling station must, on arriving at the polling station, report in person to the Presiding Officer and produce his or her identity document and a declaration of secrecy completed on the specified form by him or her.

If the area referred to in subsection (9) is occupied to its full seating capacity, the Presiding Officer may refuse entry to the polling station to any person referred to in that subsection. That Officer may make arrangements for admitting them to the polling station later.
Only an election agent or polling agent regarding whom notice of appointment has been given under this Regulation may be present in a polling station on behalf of a candidate.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person arrives at a polling station for the purpose of voting accompanied by a child; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the Presiding Officer considers that the child—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: should not be left unattended while the person is in the polling station; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: will not disturb or cause inconvenience to any person in the polling station,

subsection.continued: that Officer may permit the child to enter the polling station.

subsection.content: The Presiding Officer must not exercise the powers conferred on that Officer under this section so as to prevent a person from voting at the polling station allocated to that person.

section.name: s45
section.heading: What constitutes offence at polling station

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (6), if on polling day, within a polling station, a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: communicates with a voter or an authorized representative; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: uses a mobile telephone, paging machine or any other device for electronic communication,

subsection.continued: contrary to a direction of the Returning Officer, Assistant Returning Officer, Presiding Officer or any polling officer not to do so, that person commits an offence. (L.N. 114 of 2006)

subsection.leadIn: A person who, on polling day, films or takes photographs or makes any audio or video recording within a polling station without—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the express permission of—

subparagraph.content: the Presiding Officer; or
any member of the Commission; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the express permission, in writing, of the Returning Officer for the subsector or subsectors for which the polling station is used for polling,

subsection.continued: commits an offence.

subsection.content: A person who, on polling day, engages in canvassing for votes or displays an election advertisement within a polling station, commits an offence.

subsection.leadIn: A person who, on polling day—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in a no canvassing zone or a no staying zone or within or at a polling station—

subparagraph.content: fails to comply with a lawful order given by the Returning Officer or the Presiding Officer; or
behaves in a disorderly manner; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: contravenes section 40(14) or 41(4),

subsection.continued: commits an offence.

subsection.leadIn: A person who, without reasonable excuse, displays or wears, on polling day and within a polling station, any badge, emblem, clothing or head-dress which— (L.N. 114 of 2006)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may promote or prejudice the election of a candidate or candidates at the subsector election; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: makes direct reference to a political body in Hong Kong or to a body any member of which is standing as a candidate at the subsector election,

subsection.continued: commits an offence.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a Returning Officer;

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: an Assistant Returning Officer; (L.N. 114 of 2006)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a member of the Commission;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Chief Electoral Officer;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a person authorized in writing by a member of the Commission to so communicate;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a Presiding Officer;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a polling officer;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: a person authorized in writing by the Returning Officer to act as a liaison officer;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: a police officer on duty at a polling station; (L.N. 132 of 2009 and L.N. 197 of 2009)
a member of the Civil Aid Service on duty at a polling station; (L.N. 132 of 2009 and L.N. 197 of 2009)

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: an officer of the Correctional Services Department on duty at a dedicated polling station; or (L.N. 132 of 2009 and L.N. 197 of 2009)

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: an officer of any law enforcement agency on duty at a dedicated polling station. (L.N. 132 of 2009 and L.N. 197 of 2009)

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1), (3), (4) or (5) is liable to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 3 months. (L.N. 114 of 2006)
A person who commits an offence under subsection (2) is liable to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (L.N. 114 of 2006)

section.name: s46
section.heading: Presiding Officer to keep order at polling station

subsection.content: The Presiding Officer must keep order at the polling station.

subsection.leadIn: If, on polling day, at a polling station, a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: misconducts himself or herself, the Returning Officer or the Presiding Officer may;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: fails to obey a lawful order of the Returning Officer, that Officer may; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: fails to obey a lawful order of the Presiding Officer, that Officer may,

subsection.continued: order the person to leave the polling station or the vicinity of the polling station, as the case may require, immediately.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: If a voter or authorized representative who is allocated to vote at a dedicated polling station fails to comply with section 54(1) and (1A), the Returning Officer or the Presiding Officer may order him or her to leave the polling station immediately. (L.N. 132 of 2009)

subsection.leadIn: If a person fails to leave when ordered to do so under subsection (2) or (2A), the person may be removed— (L.N. 132 of 2009)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the polling station concerned is not a dedicated polling station, by a police officer or by a person authorized in writing by the Returning Officer or the Presiding Officer, as may be appropriate; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the polling station concerned is a dedicated polling station, by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a person authorized in writing by the Returning Officer or the Presiding Officer, as may be appropriate;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an officer of the Correctional Services Department; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: an officer of any law enforcement agency. (L.N. 132 of 2009)

subsection.content: A person who is removed under subsection (3) may not enter the relevant polling station again on that day, unless the Returning Officer or the Presiding Officer, as may be appropriate, permits him or her to do so.
The powers conferred by subsection (2) are not to be exercised so as to prevent a person from voting at the polling station allocated to that person. (L.N. 132 of 2009)

For the purpose of subsection (2) but without limiting it, a person misconducts himself or herself if the person disrupts the poll at the polling station, or disturbs or causes inconvenience to any person in the polling station.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Ballot Boxes and Ballot Papers and Procedure for Voting

section.name: s47
section.heading: Design of ballot box
section.content: A ballot box to be used for a subsector election is to be so constructed that ballot papers can be introduced into it while it is locked but cannot be withdrawn from it without unlocking it or breaking the seal or the sealing device.

section.name: s48
section.heading: Presiding Officer to seal ballot box before commencement of poll

subsection.content: Immediately before the commencement of the poll, the Presiding Officer must show each ballot box, empty, to the persons, if any, as are then present within the polling station. Then the Presiding Officer must lock the ballot box, seal it with a seal provided for that purpose or any other device specified by the Chief Electoral Officer, so that it cannot be opened without breaking the seal or the device.
The Presiding Officer must place the ballot box for the receipt of ballot papers in that Officer’s view or in the view of any other polling officers, and must keep it locked and sealed.

section.name: s49
section.heading: Form of ballot papers and order of appearance of names of candidates on ballot papers

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), a ballot paper to be used to vote at a subsector election is to be in Form 1 in Schedule 2.
If the Commission has made a direction under section 56(2) in relation to a subsector by-election, the ballot paper to be used to vote at the subsector by-election is to be in Form 2 in Schedule 2.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may decide—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to have a ballot paper printed in white or in colour or a colour pattern;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the colour in which a ballot paper is to be printed or the colour pattern to be printed on a ballot paper;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to have the ballot papers for different subsectors printed in different colours or with different colour patterns;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: whether or not to have a design on the back of a ballot paper;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the design to be printed on the back of a ballot paper; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: to have different designs printed on the back of ballot papers for different subsectors.

subsection.content: The order in which the names of candidates appear on a ballot paper is to be determined by the Returning Officer by the drawing of lots. A number is to be allocated to each candidate in accordance with the result of the draw.
A candidate may be present at the drawing of lots under this section or be represented by a person authorized in writing by him or her.
The Returning Officer must give notice to each candidate of the arrangements for the drawing of lots under this section.

subsection.leadIn: A ballot paper is to contain the following information—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the candidate;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Commission so determines, the address of the candidate as shown on the notice of nominations that has been published under section 18; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the number allocated to the candidate under this section.

subsection.leadIn: In the case of the death or disqualification of a candidate who has been allocated a number under this section, the name of the candidate and the information under subsection (7) relating to that candidate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: are to be omitted from the ballot paper; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if printed on the ballot paper, are to be crossed out, or endorsed with a marking as directed by the Commission, under section 37(2). (1 of 2019 s. 41; 8 of 2025 s. 29)

subsection.content: The number allocated to a candidate under this section is not to be altered even if the information relating to another candidate for the subsector concerned who has died or is disqualified is omitted from the ballot paper, crossed out or endorsed with a marking under subsection (8). (8 of 2025 s. 29)
A ballot paper is to have the date and description of the subsector election printed on the front of it.
A number may be printed on the counterfoil of a ballot paper, but that number is not to be printed or shown in any manner on the ballot paper.
A notice required to be given to a candidate under subsection (6) may be given to the election agent of the candidate instead of to the candidate.

section.name: s49A
section.heading: Arrangement for giving ballot papers to elderly persons, pregnant women, etc.

subsection.leadIn: The Presiding Officer may designate an area in the polling station for giving a ballot paper to a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: who is not less than 70 years of age;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whose document specified in section 50(1A)(a), (ab), (b), (c), (d), (e) or (f) shows the year of birth, without the month and day of birth, of the person which is 70 years earlier than the year within which the polling day falls;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: whose document specified in section 50(1A)(a), (ab), (b), (c), (d), (e) or (f) shows, without the day of birth—

subparagraph.content: the year of birth of the person which is 70 years earlier than the year within which the polling day falls; and
the month of birth of the person which is the same as the month within which the polling day falls;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: who is pregnant; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: who, because of illness, injury, disability or dependence on mobility aids—

subparagraph.content: is not able to queue for a long time; or
has difficulty in queuing.

subsection.leadIn: If the Presiding Officer is satisfied that a person who arrives at, or is present in, the polling station to vote falls within the description in subsection (1)(a), (b), (c), (d) or (e), the Officer may direct the person to immediately proceed to the following location to apply for a ballot paper—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the area designated under subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if there is a queue extending from that area—the end of the queue.

section.name: s50
section.heading: Ballot paper to be issued to person only if Presiding Officer is satisfied of person’s identity

subsection.content: The Presiding Officer must not issue a ballot paper to a person unless that Officer is satisfied, by inspecting the document or documents set out in subsection (1A) or (1B), that he or she is the person registered in the subsector final register, whom he or she claims to be. (L.N. 131 of 2017)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: For a person applying for a ballot paper at a polling station (other than a dedicated polling station situated in a prison), the document or documents referred to in subsection (1) are any of the following —

paragraph.name: a
ab
paragraph.content: a document issued by the Commissioner (within the meaning of section 1A(1) of the Registration of Persons Ordinance (Cap. 177)) (Commissioner of Registration) to the person certifying that the person is exempt, under regulation 25 of the Registration of Persons Regulations (Cap. 177 sub. leg. A), from being required to register under that Ordinance; (L.N. 150 of 2018)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a document issued by the Commissioner of Registration acknowledging that the person has applied—

subparagraph.content: to be registered under the Registration of Persons Ordinance (Cap. 177); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a valid Hong Kong Special Administrative Region Passport issued to the person under the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region Passports Ordinance (Cap. 539);

paragraph.name: d
e
f
paragraph.leadIn: both— (L.N. 150 of 2018)

subparagraph.content: a document evidencing a report to a police officer of the loss or destruction of the document referred to in paragraph (a), (ab) or (b); and (L.N. 150 of 2018)

a valid passport or similar travel document (not being one referred to in another paragraph in this subsection) issued to the person showing the person’s name and photograph. (L.N. 131 of 2017; L.N. 150 of 2018)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.leadIn: For a person applying for a ballot paper at a dedicated polling station situated in a prison, the document referred to in subsection (1) is a document issued by the Commissioner of Correctional Services showing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person’s name;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person’s photograph; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the prisoner registration number allocated by that Commissioner to the person for identification purposes. (L.N. 131 of 2017)

subsection.content: A person is not to be prevented from voting only due to an omission or inaccuracy of a particular required to be recorded in the subsector final register, other than the omission of both the person’s name and the identity document number.

section.name: s51
section.heading: Questions to be asked of persons applying for ballot paper

subsection.content: The Presiding Officer may, at the time a person applies for a ballot paper, but not afterwards, ask, in case of doubt, the appropriate questions set out in subsection (3).

When asking the questions, the Presiding Officer must have regard to whether the person applying for the ballot paper is a voter or an authorized representative. That Officer must choose, frame, adjust or modify the questions accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: The questions referred to in subsections (1) and (2) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: “Are you the person registered in the subsector final register now in effect for this subsector, as follows (the Presiding Officer to read the whole entry as it is recorded in the register)?” or “你是否已登記在就本界別分組正有效的界別分組正式投票人登記冊上，並且有關登記記項一如以下所述 (the Presiding Officer to read the whole entry as it is recorded in the register)?”;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: “Have you already voted for this subsector?” or “你是否已經就本界別分組投票?”.

subsection.content: The Presiding Officer must ask the appropriate questions set out in subsection (3) if so required by a candidate, an election agent or a polling agent.
The Presiding Officer must not issue a ballot paper to any person who fails to answer the questions asked of that person under this section to the satisfaction of that Officer.

section.name: s52
section.heading: Candidate or election agent or polling agent may challenge person who has applied for ballot paper or who has voted

subsection.content: If a candidate, an election agent or a polling agent declares to the Presiding Officer that he or she has reasonable cause to believe that a person has engaged in corrupt conduct by impersonation and undertakes in writing to substantiate the allegation in a court, the Presiding Officer may take the step specified in subsection (2A). A candidate, an election agent or a polling agent may so declare only at the time a person applies for the ballot paper or after a person has applied for a ballot paper and before he or she has left the polling station.

If the Presiding Officer has reason to believe that a person applying for a ballot paper or who has applied for a ballot paper and who has not left the polling station has engaged in corrupt conduct by impersonation, the Presiding Officer may take the step specified in subsection (2A).

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.leadIn: The step specified for the purposes of subsections (1) and (2) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the polling station is not a dedicated polling station, requesting a police officer to arrest the person concerned; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the polling station is a dedicated polling station, requesting an officer of the Correctional Services Department or any law enforcement agency to remove the person concerned from the polling station and report the case to the police. (L.N. 132 of 2009)

subsection.content: A person regarding whom a declaration is made under subsection (1) (whether or not that person is arrested or removed under that subsection) or a person who has been arrested or removed pursuant to a request made under subsection (2) is not to be prevented from voting only by reason of the declaration, arrest or removal. (L.N. 75 of 2011)

In this section, the reference to “corrupt conduct by impersonation” is to be construed as the corrupt conduct referred to in section 15 of the Elections (Corrupt and Illegal Conduct) Ordinance (Cap. 554). (E.R. 1 of 2020)

section.name: s53
section.heading: Presiding Officer to issue ballot papers to voter or authorized representative

subsection.content: At a polling station used only for polling for one subsector, the Presiding Officer is, subject to subsection (3), to issue one ballot paper to a person who is voting only as a voter or only as an authorized representative.

subsection.leadIn: At a polling station used for polling for more than one subsector, the Presiding Officer is, subject to subsection (3), to issue—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: one appropriate ballot paper to a person who is voting only as a voter or only as an authorized representative; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 2 appropriate ballot papers to a person who is voting as a voter and as an authorized representative.

subsection.content: Subject to section 60, if a person has been issued with a ballot paper for a subsector, a Presiding Officer must not issue another ballot paper for the subsector to that person.

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.content: If a person is entitled to be issued with 2 ballot papers, the ballot papers must be handed over to the person at the same time. (1 of 2019 s. 89)
Before a ballot paper is issued under this section, the name of the voter or authorized representative, as may be applicable, as stated in the copy of the subsector final register must be called out.

subsection.leadIn: Immediately before issuing the ballot paper, the Presiding Officer must— (14 of 2021 s. 209)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if a printed copy of the subsector final register is used to record the issue—mark the copy by placing a line across the name and identity document number of the voter or authorized representative; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if an FR electronic copy or extract (as defined by section 112) of the subsector final register is used to record the issue—make, by using an electronic device, a record in the entry relating to the voter or authorized representative in the FR electronic copy or extract,

subsection.continued: to denote that the ballot paper or ballot papers the voter or authorized representative is entitled to have issued to him or her at the relevant polling station has been or have been so issued. (14 of 2021 s. 209)

subsection.content: No record is to be made of the particular ballot paper issued to a voter or authorized representative.

section.name: s54
section.heading: Procedure for voting

subsection.content: Subject to section 55, a voter or authorized representative who has been issued with a ballot paper must immediately cast his or her vote. When a voter or authorized representative is issued with a ballot paper, he or she must immediately go into a voting compartment and mark the ballot paper as appropriate. (L.N. 114 of 2006)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: After marking a ballot paper, a voter or authorized representative must put the ballot paper into the ballot box in accordance with any direction given under subsection (1B). (L.N. 114 of 2006)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.leadIn: The Commission may direct, in such manner as it thinks fit, a voter or authorized representative—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to put the ballot paper, unfolded, into the ballot box with the marked side facing down;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: fold the ballot paper so that the marked side is inside; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: put the folded ballot paper into the ballot box;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: put the ballot paper, unfolded, into an envelope provided at the polling station; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: put the ballot paper contained in the envelope into the ballot box; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: fold the ballot paper so that the marked side is inside;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: put the folded ballot paper into an envelope provided at the polling station; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: put the ballot paper contained in the envelope into the ballot box. (L.N. 114 of 2006)

subsection.content: A voter or authorized representative must leave the polling station as soon as he or she has put the ballot paper into the ballot box.
A person must not put anything into the ballot box other than a marked ballot paper or an envelope referred to in subsection (1B). (L.N. 75 of 2011)

Except where it is provided otherwise in this Regulation, a person must not remove a ballot paper from a polling station. A person who contravenes this subsection commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.def: In this section, voting compartment (投票間) means a compartment provided under section 37(1) for the purpose of marking ballot papers.

section.name: s55
section.heading: Voter or authorized representative having left polling station without casting vote may return to cast vote under certain circumstances

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (6), a voter or authorized representative who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has been issued with a ballot paper; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has left the polling station without casting his or her vote,

subsection.continued: must not cast the vote unless before leaving the polling station, the voter or authorized representative has made a request to the Presiding Officer for permission to cast the vote at the polling station before the close of the poll and the Presiding Officer has granted the permission.

subsection.leadIn: On making a request under subsection (1), the voter or authorized representative must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inform the Presiding Officer of his or her reason for leaving the polling station without casting the vote; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: immediately give back to that Officer the ballot paper that has been issued to him or her.

subsection.content: If a voter or authorized representative has made a request under subsection (1) and has complied with subsection (2), the Presiding Officer must grant the permission unless that Officer is of the opinion that the request is a manifest abuse of the facilities provided by this section.

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.content: Despite subsections (1), (2) and (3), a voter or authorized representative to whom a permission is granted under subsection (1) by a Presiding Officer of a dedicated polling station situated in a prison must not cast the vote unless the voter or authorized representative returns to the polling station within the time slot assigned to the voter or authorized representative under subsection (3B) or section 27(2A). (L.N. 132 of 2009)

subsection.name: 3B
subsection.leadIn: If the Presiding Officer of a dedicated polling station situated in a prison grants the permission to a voter or authorized representative under subsection (1), the Commissioner of Correctional Services must, as far as practicable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: assign to the voter or authorized representative a new time slot during the polling hours appointed for the polling station; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: notify the voter or authorized representative of the new time slot. (L.N. 132 of 2009)

subsection.leadIn: If the Presiding Officer grants the permission under subsection (3), that Officer must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: keep in that Officer’s custody the ballot paper that is given to that Officer under subsection (2)(b); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on the voter’s or authorized representative’s return to the polling station before the close of the poll to cast his or her vote, return to the voter or authorized representative that ballot paper in the presence of a police officer or, if the polling station is a dedicated polling station, an officer of the Correctional Services Department or any law enforcement agency. (L.N. 132 of 2009)

subsection.content: If the Presiding Officer does not grant the permission under subsection (3), that Officer must immediately return to the voter or authorized representative the ballot paper that is given to that Officer under subsection (2)(b).

subsection.leadIn: A voter or authorized representative who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has been issued with a ballot paper;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: becomes incapacitated from voting by physical illness; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: has left the polling station without casting his or her vote,

subsection.continued: may cast the vote at the polling station before the close of the poll if before he or she leaves the polling station, the ballot paper has been given back to the Presiding Officer. In that case, the Presiding Officer must keep that ballot paper in that Officer’s custody and on the voter’s or authorized representative’s return to the polling station before the close of the poll to cast the vote, return to the voter or authorized representative that ballot paper in the presence of a police officer or, if the polling station is a dedicated polling station, an officer of the Correctional Services Department or any law enforcement agency. (L.N. 132 of 2009)

subsection.name: 6A
subsection.leadIn: If a voter in custody or an authorized representative in custody leaves a dedicated polling station situated in a prison under subsection (6), the Commissioner of Correctional Services must, as far as practicable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: assign to the voter or authorized representative a new time slot during the polling hours appointed for the polling station; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: notify the voter or authorized representative of the new time slot. (L.N. 132 of 2009)

subsection.name: 6B
subsection.content: The right of a voter in custody or an authorized representative in custody who is allocated to vote at a dedicated polling station situated in a prison to cast the vote under subsection (6) is subject to his or her returning to the polling station within the time slot assigned to him or her under subsection (6A) or section 27(2A). (L.N. 132 of 2009)

When a voter or authorized representative is returned a ballot paper under subsection (4)(b), (5) or (6), section 54 and this section apply as if the voter or authorized representative had been issued with the ballot paper.

section.name: s56
section.heading: How ballot papers are to be marked

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), a voter or authorized representative voting at a subsector election must mark the ballot paper by filling in black the ovals on it opposite the names of the candidates of his or her choice. (1 of 2019 s. 53)

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may, in relation to a subsector by-election, direct that the ballot paper must be marked with a chop provided for that purpose by the Chief Electoral Officer at the polling station and bearing the mark “✓”, with or without any design. If the Commission so directs—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a voter or authorized representative voting at the subsector by-election must mark the ballot paper with the chop; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the chop is to be affixed to give a single “✓” in the circles on the ballot paper opposite the names of the candidates of the voter’s or authorized representative’s choice.

subsection.content: At a subsector ordinary election, a voter or authorized representative may vote for as many candidates as the number of EC members to be elected by the subsector concerned. At a subsector by-election, a voter or authorized representative may vote for as many candidates as the number of EC members to be returned at the subsector by-election. (14 of 2021 s. 210)

section.name: s57
